title: Cancer Testis explorer
text: Cancer-Testis (CT) genes, also called Cancer-Germline (CG), group genes whose expression normally restricted germline found aberrantly activated many types cancers. genes produce cancer specific antigens represent ideal targets anti-cancer vaccines. Besides interest immunotherapy, can also used cancer biomarkers target anti-tumor therapies limited side effect. Many CT genes use DNA methylation primary mechanism transcriptionnal regulation. another interesting point CT genes represent suitable models study DNA demethylation cancer. Currently reference database gathering CT genes CTdatabase published 2009, based literature screening(Almeida et al., 2009). database however date. Recently identified CT genes referenced (particular CT genes identified omics methods didn’t exist time) genes referred CT genes appeared reality expressed many somatic tissues. Furthermore, database easily importable format, genes encoded properly (synonyms names rather official HGNC symbol names, concatenation ) resulting poor interoperability downstream analyses. recent studies proposed lists CT genes like Wang’s CTatlas (Wang et al., 2016, Jamin et al., 2021, Carter et al., 2023). lists established using different criteria define CT genes hence differ substantially . Moreover, lists usually provided supplemental data files strictly speaking databases. Finally, none studies describe involvement DNA methylation regulation individual CT genes. therefore created CTexploreR, Bioconductor R package, aimed redefine rigorously list CT genes based publicly available RNAseq databases summarize main characteristics. included methylation analyses classify genes according whether regulated DNA methylation. package also offers tools visualize CT genes expression promoter DNA methylation normal tumoral tissues. CTexploreR hence represents --date reference database CT genes can used starting point investigations related genes.

title: Cancer Testis explorer
text: order generate list CT genes, followed specific selection procedure (see figure ).

title: Cancer Testis explorer
text: Testis-specific genes (expressed exclusively testis) testis-preferential genes (expressed somatic tissues level lower 10x testis expression) first selected using GTEx database (Aguet et al., 2020). Note genes undetectable GTEx database due multimapping issues (flagged “lowly expressed” GTEX_category column). careful inspection genes showed many well-known Cancer-Testis genes, belonging gene families (MAGEA, SSX, CT45A, GAGE, …) members identical nearly identical sequences. likely reason genes detected GTEx database, GTEx processing pipeline specifies overlapping intervals genes excluded genes counting.genes, testis-specificity assessed using GTEx database, RNAseq data set normal tissues reprocessed order allow multimapping. Expression several genes became detectable tissues. Genes showing testis-specific expression (expression least 10x higher testis somatic tissues multimapping allowed) selected, flagged testis-specific multimapping_analysis column. Additionally, selection procedure based bulk RNAseq data, wanted ensure selected genes expressed rare populations somatic cells. used Single Cell Type Atlas classification Human Protein Atlas (Uhlén et al., 2015) exclude ones flagged specific somatic cell type.

what: Activation in cancer cell lines and TCGA tumors
title: Cancer Testis explorer
text: assess activation cancers, RNAseq data cancer cell lines CCLE (Barretina et al., 2012) TCGA cancer samples (Cancer Genome Atlas Research Network et al., 2013) used. allowed select among testis-specific testis-preferential genes activated cancers. CCLE_category TCGA_category columns, genes tagged “activated” highly expressed one percent cancer cell line/sample (TPM >= 1). However genes found expressed -almost -cancer cell lines/samples removed, probably reflects constitutive expression rather true activation. filtered genes completely repressed least 20 % cancer cell lines/samples (TPM <= 0.5). also made use normal peritumoral samples available TCGA data remove selection genes already detected significant fraction cells.

title: Cancer Testis explorer
text: selected CT genes visualised IGV (Thorvaldsdóttir et al., 2013) using RNA-seq alignment testis, ensure expression testis really corresponded canonical transcript. aim initially identify precisely transcription start site gene, unexpectedly observed genes, reads properly aligned exons, instead spread across wide genomic region spanning genes. genes, flagged “unclear” IGV_backbone column, removed CT_gene category, expression values GTEX, TCGA CCLE might reflect poorly defined transcription regions hence likely unreliable.

title: Cancer Testis explorer
text: Allows visualise gene expression GTEx tissues. can example see difference expression testis-specific testis-preferential genes. Testis-specific genes determined stricter specificity testis : lowly expressed somatic tissues least 10 times testis. Whereas testis-preferential accepts little expression outside testis : lowly expressed least 75% somatic tissues, still 10 times testis. Applied testis-specific genes : can clearly see expression strictly limited testis. can also see genes lowly expressed GTEx, thus characterized using multimapping (see ).  Applied testis-preferential genes : can see expression less stringent testis, expected, low expression tissues, always strong testis signal.
code: testis_specific <- dplyr::filter(     CT_genes,     CT_gene_type  == "CT_gene") GTEX_expression(testis_specific$external_gene_name, units = "log_TPM") ## see ?CTdata and browseVignettes('CTdata') for documentation ## loading from cache testis_preferential <- dplyr::filter(     CT_genes, CT_gene_type  == "CTP_gene") GTEX_expression(testis_preferential$external_gene_name, units = "log_TPM") ## see ?CTdata and browseVignettes('CTdata') for documentation ## loading from cache

title: Explores Cancer Testis Genes
text: CTexploreR package re-defines list Cancer Testis (CT) genes (also known Cancer Germline genes) based publicly available RNAseq databases (GTEx, CCLE TCGA) summarises main characteristics. Several visualisation functions allow explore expression different types tissues cancer cells, inspect methylation status promoters normal tissues.

what: Gene expression in CCLE Tumors — CCLE_expression
title: Gene expression in CCLE Tumors — CCLE_expression
text: Plots expression heatmap genes CCLE tumor cell lines.

title: Gene expression in CCLE Tumors — CCLE_expression
code: CCLE_expression(   genes = NULL,   type = NULL,   units = c("TPM", "log_TPM"),   include_CTP = FALSE,   values_only = FALSE )

title: Gene expression in CCLE Tumors — CCLE_expression
text: genes character naming selected genes. default value, NULL, takes CT (specific) genes. type character() describing tumor cell line(s) type plotted. Allowed cell lines "Ovarian", "Leukemia", "Colorectal", "Skin", "Lung", "Bladder", "Kidney", "Breast", "Pancreatic", "Myeloma", "Brain", "Sarcoma", "Lymphoma", "Bone", "Neuroblastoma", "Gastric", "Uterine", "Head_and_Neck", "Bile_Duct" "Esophageal". units character(1) expression values unit. Can "TPM" (default) "log_TPM" (log(TPM + 1)) include_CTP logical(1) TRUE, CTP genes included. (FALSE default). values_only logical(1). TRUE, values returned instead heatmap (FALSE default).

title: Gene expression in CCLE Tumors — CCLE_expression
